intro: Eurybia ericoides, commonly known as the heath bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has small, narrow leaves and produces violet to blue flowers in late summer. Eurybia ericoides is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
